intro: Edraianthus australis, commonly known as the Australian sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a low-growing perennial that produces clusters of small, fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and thrives in well-drained sandy or rocky soils. It is adapted to arid and coastal environments, often found in heathlands and coastal dunes. Edraianthus australis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
